item.title: GTX 480
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
eternalness:

The 5970 has…

I understand that you orgasm over the 5970, but you do not have to mention it in almost every comment. IIRC it’s simply two 5870s put together. Despite being on a single PCB it doesn’t compare to a single GPU board such as the 480. The 5970 is a separate class, with a price tag and slim availability to go with it. Go make a separate thread for it and stop bringing it up.

Oh and BTW, Fermi is simply the codename of the GF100 series of cards which includes the 470 and 480. These are currently the only Fermi(GF100) boards and neither utilizes all 512 CUDA cores. The full potential won’t be seen until “GTX 512” boards are released.

It appears that no one on this board has, or intends to buy, a 480.

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 480
item.dc:creator: koolkalang
item.description:
This has already been said, but I feel like it needs to be said again: the 5970 uses 2 cores.

the fermi thing could probably still hold true as being the fastest, if you judged the 5970 as being two cores.

But in the near future, I see myself getting a 5870 more than anything.

item.title: GTX 480
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
King_Kaddo:

The shittiest card from nvidia evaaaa.

WRONG. In fact the worst card from Nvidia would most likely come from their weakest lineup, the FX series. The shittiest cards from nvidia are some of the early FX cards.

Fermi (GTX400) has potential, wait til it matures and the prices lower. Nvidia is playing catchup because they are late. Radeon 6000 should be here in 2011, so it will be interesting to see what ATI’s refresh will be in the meantime.

More interesting will be the answer Nvidia will have to ATI’s 6000 series in the form of a Fermi refresh.

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 480
item.dc:creator: sm00t
item.description:
Not a fanboy but I’ve allways used nvidia…(starting to wonder)
I just bought a gtx 275 after burning up my 8800 ultra that I had for about 3 years, (heat) and I do clean the case out…I dont know if its heat but the 275 craps out after about 10 or 11 minutes…
I’m gonna try ATI next.
Dell XPS 720 750 watt power supply…
Doesnt work on hl2-ep1 or ep2 mostly…

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 480
item.dc:creator: coldroll
item.description:
I will not buy another gpu for at least 4 years I’m happy with my gtx 280 sli setup, and also I did not buy them at full price when they came out. The computer store I bought them from was selling 9800gx2’s at the time and when the cards where coming that day they offered me two gtx 280’s at the same price as 2 9800gx2’s. Also the gtx 480 sounds hella hot, I wonder if any computer case on air cooling will be able to cool that puppy. I think you’d probably need water cooling for that card.

Read full topic
